text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hussein, visiting Ireland, rejects any changes to Jerusalem before final status talks between Palestinians and Israelis.
- Crown Prince Hassan, addressing "Fear of Peace" seminar, says Middle East must be free from weapons of mass destruction.
- Mayor of Zarqa detained; parliamentary deputies call for him to be held without bail after he said three quarters of them were liars.
- Deputy Prime Minister Abdullah Ensour says contacts underway to form an Arab-Israeli commission to discuss Palestinian refugees.
- Twenty-three parliamentary deputies call for a law forbidding detention of nationals for more than 24 hours without going to court.
- EU officials say Jordan has qualified for second tranche of EU grant and all issues in EU-Jordan partnership negotiations have been completly solved.
- Ensour says Prime Minister Abdul-Karim al-Kabariti to reshuffle cabinet at end of parliamentary session in mid-March.
- Private sector to be allowed to set up agencies to employ Jordanians abroad, Labour Minister says.
- King Hussein warns against Israeli moves against Arab East Jerusalem.
- FBI head Louis Freeh in Jordan today.
